website_summaries.verdict: Ergonomic feel and 60-foot range are great, but software compatibility can be lacking.
pros: Feels great in the hand and is easy to use
Strong laser pointer and long battery life
cons: Real picky about what presentation software it will work well with -- great with Powerpoint, iffy with others

customer_reviews.title: Good for 50ft or less
customer_reviews.text: I had higher hopes for this than i got. Honestly I thought the range would be better according to the reviews. I was using this for a remote presentation and was maybe 100ft from the pc and had connectivity issues. Within about 50ft it seemed to work ok, but any further was hit and miss. I changed out batteries, moved the dongle and everything else. My best guess is the transmitter just isn't beefy enough or the reciever strong enough for real distances. If you're under that limit than i think this will work for your needs. anything more than that and I'd suggest the smklink brand. i've got 200ft from it, of course it's twice the price too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M. Wollesen

customer_reviews.title: Poor range and sometimes loses connection.
customer_reviews.text: Changed over to this after my 10+ year old Logitech model died. I'm not happy with it compared to the other. Pros: - Compact size and good form factor. - Has a screen black out button. This is a must have. Cons: - Loses connection in a decent sized training room. I had to be near the front of the room for it to work. That's really frustrating when you're teaching a class or giving a presentation. - Sometimes it just doesn't click through - you press it, and nothing happens. Then, sometimes it advances several slides at once. Not great. - Laser is really weak, and barely shows up.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Stokes

customer_reviews.title: useable with long fingernails
customer_reviews.text: My wife, with her stylishly long fingernails, couldn't reliably press the buttons on the wireless presenter that I use, so I bought her this one. This has been in production so long it could be considered a classic -- and rightly so. My wife finds it comfortable to hold, the buttons easy to locate by feel, and reliable to press -- even with long fingernails. It really does work up to about 60 feet away. And did you know that when you insert the USB receiver into it's slot in the base of the presenter that it disables the presenters buttons (it turns the presenter off)? How convenient.
customer_reviews.author: BF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent remote
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these. The first one went through five years of travel and presentations, and it worked reliably before I finally dropped it on the floor just one too many times. I have tried others as a guest lecturer, and also tried a less expensive one before realizing that it is simply the best out there for the money. It is ergonomic, responsive, and more durable than you’d ever expect!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and effetive
customer_reviews.text: Love this laser pointer. Very professional piece of kit. The red laser pointer is bright and intuitive. The usb receiver has always worked seamlessly for me (and I've been using it on lots of different systems, including mac and pc). The usb receiver fits inside the main device when it's not being used so it's easy to carry around as one piece. This product comes with the required 2 AAA batteries and these are easy to replace if required.
customer_reviews.author: Tori P.

customer_reviews.title: Great For Teachers or Presenters
customer_reviews.text: I have used this both as a graduate student and as a teacher, and it was perfect in both environments. I always feel sorry for teachers who feel tethered to their computers during powerpoint presentations, because this controller allows you to walk around freely while being in control of your presentation. I also ended up using the laser pointer way more than I thought I would. A quick warning if you have fidgety hands, the USB piece is really fun to click in and out of the main body of the controller so make sure you don't break it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Garner

customer_reviews.title: Great longevity/Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This is my second of this model, and I cannot say enough great things about this remote. I teach public speaking in college and give a number of presentations myself. My last remote lasted a good five years and only died because I dropped it on a concrete floor. This "clicker" is super easy-to-use (practically idiot proof), has great longevity, and is compact. The laser point feature is great for teachers. I literally carry this around in my work bag and find myself offering it to other presenters because it is that easy to use. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Amber T. McGinnis

customer_reviews.title: Works well but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice design and works very well. I never use the laser beam as I don't want to blind anyone or look like a total dork. My problem is with their Customer Service. Or lack of it. WARNING: Some day you WILL lose/misplace the USB receiver. Kensington' response to this is: tough luck. They maintain that each USB receiver is unique to the clicker. So they're making snowflakes? I don't believe it. Shame on you Kensington
customer_reviews.author: Pauken Player

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my classroom. A++
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! You pop out the USB connector from the actual unit and plug it right into your computer or laptop and it instantly syncs with it. I love the red laser pointer and how I can now switch slides from anywhere in my classroom. This thing is ergonomic and fits perfectly and comfortably in my hand. So comfortably that sometimes I forget I’m holding it and I drop it. LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2KidsDogsHorses

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS THING!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make giving presentations easier. I had actually used this exact one before I bought it (I checked it out at our library.) Anyway, this works on any computer and you don’t even have to do the whole (installing device crap) literally, plug it in and go! It’s fantastic. Plus, it has a laser pointer which is great for when you are showing specific points in graphs or photos that may be much higher than you or too far away.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: WIRELESS CLICKER ALSO WORKS GREAT WITH DESKTOP COMPUTERS, TOO!
customer_reviews.text: Kensington wireless clicker is what we use at work, and what I needed for my travels as a training presenter. Also discovered that it works on desktop computers, too, when no laptop computer available. Red laser pointer is barely noticeable on screens, but I do not use those beams. Instead, I point to display to emphasize points. That's better engagement with your audiences. Donald E. White, American Red Cross Disaster Instructor, Fairfax City, VA.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E. White

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I have more than one of these. There was one in a classroom I taught in a few years ago and I really liked it. I looked around to see what else was out there, but I couldn't find anything I liked better. It has all the features I want and is really easy to use. No extra software needed.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Innerst

customer_reviews.title: Works with Mac
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, borrowed from someone for two years in a row. Made the investment. As a teacher with students who give presentations for many days in a row, for many years in a row, reliability was key. And this works like a charm. Has not failed me and the laser pointer is an added bonus. Students love using it and feel comfortable and at ease with the product yet, professional, and that is part of implementing a good presentation.
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: Compatibility with the MacBook Air laptop
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this Kensington Wireless Presenter to use with my MacBook Air laptop. Used it the first week of August for a training class. Basic features for moving forward or back in PowerPoint worked as you would expect - flawlessly. Red laser pointer also works well - easy to reach with your thumb. USB-A thumb drive antenna fits in the end of the presenter when not in use with your laptop. The presenter fits comfortably in the palm of your hand, and it’s light weight. Recommend purchasing the Aproca Hard Travel Storage Case that’s compatible with the Kensington Wireless Presenter. A prefect combo to transport and protect your wireless presenter.
customer_reviews.author: RG@az

customer_reviews.title: Works extremely well and the laser pointer is a nice extra.
customer_reviews.text: As a teacher who uses a Promethean board, and who makes many presentations with PowerPoint... I have to say I truly enjoy being able to walk wherever I choose in the room as I change slides (back, or forward).. and the little laser pointer is an added feature I enjoy--it works quite well. My only reason for 4 instead of 5 is that for "some" other applications (e.g. movies, DVD's etc) the thing doesn't work and others around the same price do...it would've been even better had it the capacity to stop, start, pause or reverse even a movie. That said... for demos using PowerPoint it is extremely well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Myword

customer_reviews.title: I love this wireless presenter
customer_reviews.text: I love this wireless presenter. I teach at a small, private liberal arts college and would usually borrow this type of equipment from the library. I am so glad that I have my own now. It is a lot easier to walk around the classroom and stay engaged with my students using this clicker rather than being restricted to the podium to advance my own slides. I have found that sometimes the laser pointer feature is hard to aim/see.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa G

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I give professional presentations to many different groups and this device has never let me down. The usb connector that's stored in the handset means that it'll never get lost. I easily and quickly move between slides. The device itself is small enough to be hidden in my hand but large and ergonomic enough to be comfortable and not easily lost.
customer_reviews.author: JRNJ

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for the job
customer_reviews.text: Since I'm starting to do more presentations, and having to do some where I can't even access my computer when doing them, I started the search for a decent clicker. Having borrowed some while talking at conferences, I know that quality can be a hit or miss affair. So, I checked reviews and decided to pick this up right before a road trip to give a presentation. Setup on my Mac was very easy, and operation was trouble-free. The laser pointer is a good bonus, and very helpful for highlighting detailed items. The storage for the USB dongle is also a great addition, especially when on the road. Overall, I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Charlieartist

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Presentation Mice out there...this is the BEST
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several of these. For personal use and for church use. A most excellent presentation mouse. Simple to use. Easy to pass to someone else to use with minimal instruction. Uses two triple A batteries and they seem to last forever. Just do not lose the antennae/receiver. If it is lost or damaged you cannot buy a replacement. Each presentation mouse is uniquely synced to its antennae/receiver and a different one will not work. I have tried other presentation mouse . . . mouses? mice? whatever they are. And this is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Roy H.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Used this for power point presentations in College. Very easy to use just plug in and start using. It made my presentations much more professional and smooth. It might sound strange but I am not a great public speaker and presentations make me nervous, having this in my hand helped ease some anxiety and keeps your hands busy with the laser pointer rather than in my pocket or fidgeting.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I give presentations but also run a lot of meetings, and I like to take notes during those meetings. It's difficult to focus on the message and the notes when you've got one hand hovering over the arrow keys, waiting to hear "Next slide please!" Worse, the presenters know exactly where they want to go and you're hunting and pecking through their slides for them. I plug the wireless thingy into the USB port, hand the presenter the controller and say, "YOU control your own destiny!" and away we go. My attention is free to focus on the content of the pitch and my hands are free to take notes/meeting minutes. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M.

customer_reviews.title: Love it - my third one.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for PowerPoint presentations and it’s a slick solution. You just pop out the USB adapter which resides inside the unit, pop it into your computer’s USB port, and you’re good to go. It also has a built-in laser pointer which is cool. It has 4 buttons; two for going forward and backward through presentations, and a third for the laser pointer. The 4th button blacks out the screen out during breaks, etc. Handy. It does what I bought it for simply and easily, works perfectly every time Reason I bought a third is because the first two got “borrowed.” Permanently. But I’ll chalk that up to it being a great ‘in demand’ product!
customer_reviews.author: bythecshore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for clicking through your amazing presentation
customer_reviews.text: I do this job thing where I have to talk to people and often have a clever presentation with big words and pretty photos on it behind me. I've used a lot of clickers in my five years in this position and this is by far the most solid. The USB doo-hickey fits snug inside of it when you don't need it. The cover is a nice rubber. Battery door is sturdy. Responsive and the button layout is easy to decipher from the get-go. Battery life is quite good as well. Love the laser pointer as well as the feature to turn the screen off when needed. The best clicker I've ever clicked.
customer_reviews.author: R.Robot

customer_reviews.title: Great, consistent
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this model of a clicker for 7 years for TEDx events. Great, consistent, and durable device. Just note that if you start needing "distance" or larger throws, you should consider getting a USB to ethernet adapter so that you can throw an ethernet cable from your production booth to the stage. Once we discovered this, we've never had issues with clicking and can handle any distance.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Laser is very weak
customer_reviews.text: The remote works great passing the slides of a power point or Google Slides, but the laser light is very weak and cannot be seen at all, even in a dark room. I tried changing the batteries, but still, did not work. I would try to return it, but when getting the remote out of the box, I broke the box.
customer_reviews.author: ElectroArt

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Kensington presenter. The shape is easy to hold, it takes standard batteries, it’s easy to insert and to store the piece that is plugged into the USB port on the computer, and the laser is reliable. I bought a second one because I lecture, and a presenter is really essential...and I don’t want to be without one...
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: My team loves this little tool
customer_reviews.text: My team loves this little tool. Makes presenting so much easier. Great laser pointer, connect easily wireless. If you work in a corporate environment and are an administrative assistant you must have one of these on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: No Bueno
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t cover 20’ of distance even with the best batteries. Virtually useless.
customer_reviews.author: UpDownAllAround

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to Hold, Lightweight and Functional
customer_reviews.text: These work really well. Distance is limited to about 50 feet with few obstructions. We've been lucky to go about 65 feet with a clear view of the receiver. The batteries will last a few months with normal use as a clicker, but less if you utilize the laser pointer. We still have one of these, in an older model, that has been going strong for 7 years now.
customer_reviews.author: Shoemaker

customer_reviews.title: Feels Good in the Hand, Intuitive Button Layout, Works Great on Different Computers
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of presentations for my aerospace company. The ones provided by the company tend to get beat up or go missing. I decided to get my own so I'd always have one. I tried a Logitech that gets good reviews. It works great, but the tapered shape does not feel good to me. This one feels perfect in my grip. The layout of the the buttons in an exact perpendicular quadrant are completely intuitive. I have used this presenter on numerous different laptops and tower computers. It works even on computers where I do not have administrative rights because there is NO SOFTWARE INSTALLATION REQUIRED. Simply plug and go. It works right every time!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Preyer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've purchased this item (left #1 at a conference earlier this year). I find this presenter reliable, easy to use, just the right size, with no gimmicks. If I could improve one thing, I'd add a control light that indicates the charge of the battery, but there's a reason I repurchased the exact item I had before -- it works very well and is easy to carry. (I actually like that it doesn't come in a pouch of its own, as I carry it in a pouch with my wall charger.)
customer_reviews.author: sconnie

customer_reviews.title: A must for presenters.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic presentation remote. It has all the features I need and works great with OS X and Keynote. The remote auto turns off when the receiver is placed back in the remote, which is great for batter life. The pointer is still visible from across an average sized room and it feels great in the hand. I would recommend this to anyone who is giving presentations, especially those who consistently use Macs; the screen black out feature works in Keynote. That doesn’t happen often with most presentation remotes; that’s why this one is such a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Radtke

customer_reviews.title: Better quality than my previous remotes, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: Lost the part that connects to my computer; remote is now useless. Left in a classroom used by many others, as I hurried to my second presentation of a busy morning. Our IT department has many of these. Unfortunately they are unique and not interchangeable. Basically out $30 for a remote I used twice
customer_reviews.author: Denise ABC

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have a Mac, and utilize this presenter with Keynote. I use it while I preach sermons at my church, and it works fine. Never have had any problems, and the laser comes in handy when I point to certain things. I've not had any problems. The only 'almost-problem' I had, was when I first plugged it into my Mac, it told me to hit a certain key so the software could ascertain what keyboard I had. It kept on searching, and never told me if it recognized it. However, it worked without error as soon as I loaded up Keynote. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin RK Davis

customer_reviews.title: Does What I Want it to do
customer_reviews.text: Got off to a bad start. First unit shipped to me didn't work. Apparently, the presenter was not matched with the USB receiver. Amazon quickly sent me a replacement, which worked as described. My wife was the first user, for a presentation of a quilt slide show. She found it easy to hold and operate; it correctly performed the features of a PowerPoint slide show. One complaint about its design: It did not handle correctly the showing of a list of JPEG pictures -- I have used other presenters that did so correctly. But I can't gig the K33374USB; the description says PPT only.
customer_reviews.author: ZumDum

customer_reviews.title: The Kensington Laser Pointer is everything you need
customer_reviews.text: I have been teaching for over 30 years, so I can appreciate a laser pointer that works well in any setting. The Kensington Laser Pointer does just that. It's easy to hold, ergonomic, and works like a charm. I'd recommend it to any presenters who need an outstanding laser pointer.
customer_reviews.author: tm

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine had one of these and I loved the feel and response I got from it. It fits so well in your hand and is not a distraction to the participants while instructing. Works on both mac and window systems. Easy plug and play and I have never had to fiddle with drivers. I keep one with me at all times and even swap out if I arrive and they have a remote in place. I have come to totally trusting this remote! Look no further, I would be surprised if you didn't like it.
customer_reviews.author: JanTru

customer_reviews.title: Laser Pointer Works Only When Receiver Connected to PC
customer_reviews.text: The laser pointer is good but I was disappointed to discover that it works only if the little receiver is plugged into a USB port on my PC. I understand the receiver is needed for the remote control functions but most of the time all I need is the laser pointer. It should work with or without the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: PeterM

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much as expected
customer_reviews.text: No surprises here. Not the smallest around, so not sure if it fits that requirement if you're traveling with it. It DOES have a very nice feel in your hand with the shape being very comfortable. I also like that fact that with the usb fob "docked" in the unit, it is automatically turned off. If you want to simply use it as a laser pointer, the fob clicks out so that it is "on" but is till captive and won't fall out. Finally, I continue to appreciate that it uses standard AAA batteries instead of hard to find watch batteries used on the really small versions of this.
customer_reviews.author: Barney

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Functional!
customer_reviews.text: This presenter and laser pointer is perfect for my use. When I received it, I instantly plugged it in to try it out. There was no setup required or installation. There are four buttons: - Forward and Reverse in the slide show presentation - A red laser pointer - a button to make the presentation black screen if you need the audience to focus on what you are saying for a minute. Other nice features: The USB transmitter stays plugged into the bottom of the presenter when it isn't in use and the laser cannot be used when the USB is in this position (so you don't waste battery if you throw it in your bag).
customer_reviews.author: HandyMom

customer_reviews.title: Kensington Wireless Pointer
customer_reviews.text: I have owned one of these pointers before. Unfortunately, someone liked it better than I did, so I've ordered another one just like the original. I was impressed by the ability of this pointer to work in large rooms without failing to respond to the pointer commands during a presentation. The USB dongle stays with the unit until needed (internal storage), and that keeps the battery from running down or discharging by accident. Overall, I will continue to purchase this very same one or the latest and greatest available model from Kensington should my latest purchase grow legs and wonder off, again.
customer_reviews.author: Micky Farrington

customer_reviews.title: Bought this because I had one from 2012, which ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I had one from 2012, which I lost somewhere. Anyway, bought this thing and in 6 months it does not work if you walk more than 8 feet from the computer. I don't know what happened to this thing but it does not work as well as the older units. I need something that will give me 20ft range it only gives me 8ft. Look at something else.
customer_reviews.author: Maranatha

customer_reviews.title: good clicker
customer_reviews.text: good clicker I use it with my Samsung DeX while connected to my note 9 with my power point presentations , works flawlessly and I'm always around 30' away. the built in laser pointer is an awesome touch comes in very handy to emphasize a section of the presentation.
customer_reviews.author: El Castro

customer_reviews.title: A must have device for Powerpoint communicators
customer_reviews.text: This device is awesome. I bought it based on other co-workers use. It helps for presenting, does the job with no technology issues of it not working when you need it during a presentation, and the laser works well. A feature I love is where the laser only works if the USB plug in is not inside the device -- I have had laser pojnters which burn through the battery because they go on while in my bag. It can't happen with this. Also, the USB plug in fits into the device nicely and clips in strong so you don't lose it and have to be responsible to track 2 pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Krot

customer_reviews.title: This is the best presenter you can buy
customer_reviews.text: Cost taken into account. This is the best presenter you can buy. I have very big fingers and I hate it when people are presenting and they accidentally click the advance button instead of the laser pointer but because this is so large, it mediates that problem. They're a little fragile so don't accidentally drop them too much. I dropped mine by accident and it stopped working but I bought another one. That's how committed to these I am. You cannot go wrong with these. They're perfect AND they come with batteries which I appreciate very much.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Price

customer_reviews.title: defective
customer_reviews.text: I put everything together and it did not work. I told my tech guy to try it and it still did not work. Since I opened the package and everything, I will not return it. But, so sad... I had one just like it before and it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Malibu

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: l bought this for our physician to do seminars, We received this product about 2 hours prior to the seminar, He opened the package; connected to our projector and started "Clicking." Our physician was using Prezi power point without a problem. the slides both enlarged and advanced as expected. The red beam was visible in a large auditorium. We are very happy with this product and definitely good for the price. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Coach H

customer_reviews.title: Best presenter ever!
customer_reviews.text: The exceptionally light-weight Kensington 33374 plug-and-play Wireless Presenter with Laser Pointer fits easily in my women's 6 1/2 (small) glove-size hands. Often I forget it's in my hand. It is wonderful to not feel tethered to the computer keyboard or mouse when speaking to an audience. This device enables me to walk into the audience seating area and engage with them more interactively and fluidly, then when I have to keep running to a podium or projector table to advance to the next slide.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Allows freedom to walk around and teach when using Power Point slides!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this presenter as it allows me the freedom to walk around the room and advance slides. We sometimes do movement activities that use Power Point, so I let a responsible student be in charge of the pointer. They really like that!! One suggestion that I took from another teacher-- put a magnet on the back of it so it can "live" on your whiteboard. It gets lost easily, and for younger students, it is a big enticement to mess around with it when it is not placed out of reach.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: SMALL, PORTABLE WIRELESS PRESENTER WITH RED LASER - EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: Conduct monthly presentations and found this wireless pointer/clicker to be a good investment. It's small, portable, has its own case, extremely easy to use, the USB fits nicely inside the clicker and it's easy to operate. Often times I will give the clicker to others and can literally just point to the arrows to let them know how to operate and were the point button is. Everyone loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Andora

customer_reviews.title: Range too short
customer_reviews.text: I bought this remote as a backup to a Satechi SP-400 and was sadly disappointed. It has less than half the range of the Satechi and lacks several features I use. The Satechi has a button for blanking the screen and a separate button for changing the presentation mode as well as a switch which lets you use it as a remote mouse. The Kensington advanced slides eratically when 25 feet from the computer and failed completely at 35 feet. The range was unsatisfactory in our auditorium. The Satechi SP-400 operates fine from 75 feet away. I returned the Kensington and bought another Satechi SP-400. The Satechi is well worth the extra $5.
customer_reviews.author: L. BRACKEEN

customer_reviews.title: I bought this a few years ago and it still works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: It gets really good reception from the fob on the laptop. I can walk to the back corner of the classroom and click it and it works the same as if I'm right next to the laptop. It just needs a clear line of sight to the USB fob.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie K

customer_reviews.title: Enhanced my presentation
customer_reviews.text: I have small hands, and I like how this feels in my hand. The advance/reverse buttons were responsive, but I only roamed about 6 feet from my computer. I found that the laser pointer was rather faint on the projector screen, while it looked to be about "average" brightness when pointing it against a wall. Admittedly, I haven't tried a new set of batteries, as I was able to walk up to the projection screen and point if someone couldn't discriminate the laser pointer; so for me it wasn't a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: softball06

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, basic and reliable
customer_reviews.text: This simple remote has one clever design aspect (the built-in USB adapter) and one significant flaw (it's far too easy to hit the bottom "screen off" button in the middle of a presentation). But if you don't need anything fancy, this is a good, inexpensive choice. It's played well with every Mac and PC I've plugged it into. One way that Kensington could make their next model more useful would be for the USB adapter to double as a thumbdrive. Since you'll be plugging it into the host computer anyway, why not put your presentation on it? Sadly, the small dongle's only purpose is to provide a wireless connection.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Burnham

customer_reviews.title: Good all around presenter.
customer_reviews.text: I like this presenter. It is big enough to fit in my hand well. The buttons are far enough apart that I don't push the wrong one. It only has the buttons that I need. The laser is bright enough, and the unit turns off when the radio receiver is inserted back into to the presenter. Based on Amazon customer reviews I previously purchased the Logitech Wireless Presenter R400, but found it too small, and people who were using it were constantly pushing the wrong button.
customer_reviews.author: J.C., Lyons CO

customer_reviews.title: I tested it at home on my desktop with perfect results. Took it to my first power point ...
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as it is supposed to. I tested it at home on my desktop with perfect results. Took it to my first power point presentation last night and installed it on another laptop being used for the program. It would not work, but finally clicking on the hidden icons button revealed that Windows was searching for an up to date driver, which it found, downloaded and installed. Took a few minutes for this to happen, and then the product worked great.
customer_reviews.author: astrostar

customer_reviews.title: excellent product, good price
customer_reviews.text: I work for a school, and the teachers wanted a way to show PowerPoint presentations without being tied to the computer at their desks. This has been an excellent purchase. It worked right from the start, just plug in the USB wireless access and it was good to go. We use Windows 7 on our computers. I'm pleased with the storage in the hand set, because things get lost very easily in a classroom. We have been using it for three months now, and the battery is still good. It does only one thing, run PowerPoints, which is good, because it does that very well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schechter

customer_reviews.title: Nice pointer and controller
customer_reviews.text: It works well for controlling presentations and as a laser pointer. It was reasonably priced, and has a good range. I particularly like the way the wireless receiver is stored inside the controller. When fully inserted, the laser won't work. This controller just gets tossed into a pocket in my laptop bag. I travel - a lot - to customer sites where I conduct training. Unlike other laser pointers I've used, I have never had dead batteries when I've pulled this pointer out of the bag. That alone makes it worth any extra I paid over a simple pointer.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell McCarroll

customer_reviews.title: no on/off power switch
customer_reviews.text: works as advertised, no problems, except, this is the first remote presenter that I have seen that doesn't have a power switch. you have to plug the receiver in, in order to turn it off. this means battery life will be reduced for installations where the receiver stays plugged into a computer.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hoefling

customer_reviews.title: Like the generous spacing between buttons
customer_reviews.text: Like the generous spacing between buttons. Like the feel in my hand. The USB storage is fantastic. Most elegant of all devices I have owned (have owned two from other makers - one is a cheap ~ $10 and the other a brand name ~$35). Simple and nearly impossible to make mistakes. The only thing I wish better is the laser diode. It is a bit under power and quite hard to see if the room is bright.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe H

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I do PowerPoint presentations pretty regularly and have used a few different clickers. They all seem to work but the range on this one is better than at least some I have used. It worked on the MacBook Pro and Windows 7 & 8 laptops I have used and it fits comfortably in the hand which is nice. I also like that the receiver parks in the transmitter and shuts off the power. I have not changed the batteries in a few months. The laser seems OK but I rarely use one so can't really compare it.
customer_reviews.author: Daine P

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For PPT Presentation.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use for our church service. We use PPT for our music lyrics and sermon note slides. This clicker is perfect for clicking through the slides from anywhere in the auditorium (small gym size). There was no interference from any cellphones. Great price for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Euchrechic1211

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: I needed a device that would let me advance my PowerPoint presentation as I roamed a workshop, speaking. This one from Kensington works flawlessly on my MacBook. It has a nice, ergonomic grip. And the USB antenna tucks neatly into the handle of the wand. Its only minor drawback? I didn't award 5 stars because the laser pointer projects a tiny dot, not a big dot; it's a bit hard to detect. Not really a complaint: I hardly ever use the laser pointer and didn't buy the device for that feature. I'm traveling and speaking several times a month and now rely on this wireless presenter as essential equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Ahern

customer_reviews.title: A++ Operation
customer_reviews.text: I bought this clicker for my Power Point presentations during my guest speaking engagements. It worked flawlessly. I sailed through each slice and blanked out the screen when I wanted to hide the slide while I made a particular point in the presentation. Afterwards I tested the clicker at the back of the auditorium and it worked just as well as it did behind the podium. I like the fact that the USB stick easily stores in the clicker so I won't have to worry about them getting separated and loss. Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: ALWAYS RELIABLE
customer_reviews.text: My last clicker from KENSINGTON lasted over 10 years PLUS - I had to replace it and of course, went with another KENSINGTON - easy to use and I recommend to ALL MY CLIENTS.
customer_reviews.author: janine burke

customer_reviews.title: Good for those with fine motor controls
customer_reviews.text: Good for those with fine motor control, but I found the direction button too close to the selection key and I frequently end up on the wrong Power Point slide.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Brady

customer_reviews.title: Decent presenter but doesn't work with all USB ports on my laptop
customer_reviews.text: I would give it 5 stars if it worked with all 4 USB ports on my Lenovo laptop. It works with two and the two other ports accept the wireless transmitter as a new device (Windows makes a clicking sound) but the presenter doesn't do anything. The transmitter doesn't show green light in those ports as it normally does when it make a connection with the presenter. So, it may be just my laptop or the presenter (its USB transmitter) is "picky". The presenter itself does it job when I work with PowerPoint: moving to next/previous slides, blackening screen to pause, laser pointer works well.
customer_reviews.author: O. Zhukhovitskiy

customer_reviews.title: Got him this and it 1 worked great to advance his slides and 2nd distracted him so ...
customer_reviews.text: My boss really wanted a Lazer pointer for presentstions. Got him this and it 1 worked great to advance his slides and 2nd distracted him so I could sneak out of the office. Win win. Also he was very excited and satisfied with it. He likes to be critical, but after not hearing any complaints I can only assume he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Tidus

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: The best presenter device I have found. Easy to pop into any computer or laptop with a USB. Same design as my old one. Simply replace the battery like once a year and it's ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: M. Teske

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: As a officer for student organizaiton on my campus and for many of my biology classes, having this tool is great for presentations and meetings. I am able to switch from my presentation and a black screen with ease without missing a beat. It's also very professional when we have guest speakers and give this to them so they are able to control their presentation as well. This will be put to the real test for a conference we are planning for month. What made me finally get it, after having it in my wishlist for months, was that it was on sale for $14.99 + shipping & tax, which came out to like $19. Heck yea! TigerDirect is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: The perfect tool for presentations
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for powerpoints and other simple presentation formats. High quality product that works well and provides the needed functionality for those who don't want to stand at their computer the whole time or get someone else to do it. Just plug in the USB and it starts working pretty much instantly. Works well with Windows, Mac, and even Linux with a little effort. I highly recommend the green laser as it is much brighter due to eye physiology.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Hubel

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY for OS X and PowerPoint
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for use on Mac OS X with PowerPoint. It works intermittently at best. Plugging in the USB and navigating through slides seems to work. But, after presenting for a period of time it simply stops working. Clicking buttons is non responsive. The only way to fix it is to pull out the USB and re-insert it back into the computer. The cycle simply repeats itself until you lose confidence in it working, and stay close to your computer to manually flip the slides. I would not recommend this for OS X and PowerPoint. I have not test it with other operating systems / presentation software.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I do the power point presentation for my church every Sunday morning. It is a great tool for anybody that works with power Point in a group setting. You can untether from the computer. I was impressed with the range that I could get away from the computer. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: greatuncledad

customer_reviews.title: Great little remote
customer_reviews.text: The remote has pretty good range, but you may want to get a USB extension cord if your computer/laptop USB connection is being blocked by any walls/materials that shorten range. I love that the dongle stores inside the remote, which also acts as an on/off switch (if the dongle is in, you can't use the laser pointer). My only complaint is that I would prefer the remote use AA batteries over AAA, but I don't think the batteries should drain too fast.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Azali

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but small pointer
customer_reviews.text: The clicker is easy to use, the only drawback is the the pointer is relatively small (sometimes it is hard to see if you are standing close to the screen). It is compatible with Mac (Adobe and Preview) and with Ubuntu.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Presenter on September 27, have used it three different dates and each time it quite working so I would change the batteries. I don't believe it is the batteries. Once I pull out the USB fob it works for a couple minutes then quits. If I return the fob and then take it out, same deal. I would like to exchange it for a new on but don't see that option. In the past these have been great to work with. Any help here?
customer_reviews.author: JW Lycan

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Mac OS X, Windows, and Linux
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Takes normal batteries. 2. Bright, well-focused laser. 3. Uses radio frequency communication, not IR, so you do not need line-of-sight to the computer. It will go through a wood podium. 4. Works great with Apple Keynote and Microsoft Powerpoint. 5. Works great with Mac OS X, Windows, and Linux. 6. No need to screw around with Bluetooth. Cons: None
customer_reviews.author: Tropylium

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and works great with a Mac for keynote
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product and worth spending a little more than some of the other options. It's very much plug-and-play. Just pop in the usb and it's immediately ready to go. It fits comfortably in the hand and isn't too heavy. The usb clicks into the handle for easy storage, making it harder to misplace. It has a laser and 4-way navigation. I use mine with Keynote on my macbook running Mountain Lion OSX 10.8 and had no problems. If I could give it more than 5 stars I definitely would.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: best presenter controller on the market
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say other than that we have tried numerous wireless presenters for PP presentations and this is the only one that is sufficiently intuitive that we can hand it to a random PhD and walk away knowing that they won't screw up their presentation (at least due to the controller). It has a comfortable grip, the buttons are easy to find but not so easy that when a presenter is flailing about on the stage, he or she accidentally runs through all the slides in the presentation. Blackout feature is nice, get the model with the laser pointer and hope the presenter doesn't "accidentally" walk off with it.
customer_reviews.author: H. Kaczmarski

customer_reviews.title: Useful little tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tool for those who give PowerPoint presentations on a regular basis. It has all the basics I need: forward and backward, laser, and blank screen. Once or twice I wished maybe I could use it to move my mouse, but that's a different tool (that costs more money). It fits nicely in my hand and is comfortable to use, and I like the laser turns off when you store the USB dingle-hopper-thingy in the main piece (and other buttons), thereby preserving your batteries when it is packed in your suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gab

customer_reviews.title: Improves your presentations
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews that discuss this model as compared to others say it all, but I would add that if you aren't using a remote with your presentations yet, this one is a good place to start. It frees the presenter from the podium and computer so you can move around the room. Research shows that audiences learn better and enjoy presentations more when the speaker is more animated and uses the whole staging area. You can't do that when you are tethered to the computer. I love the handy storage slot for the USB drive.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made and works fine.
customer_reviews.text: A little bulkier than I had hoped, but very nicely designed. The wireless dongle is cleverly stored inside the pointer, and the pointer can't be turned on accidentally when the dongle is in its little storage slot--a nice feature if you intend to use it while traveling...you won't end up with dead batteries. This works with any laptop, including Macs.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Simple product, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of clickers out there with a whole slew of features, but what I really needed was quite simple: move forward, backward, and have a laser pointer. This Kensington fits all my needs. It can't get any easier to set up, too. Before class, all I have to do is insert the USB stick into the computer and it's all ready to go. I teach in a small class, so I really don't have to be 200 feet away. If you need a clicker for simple needs without anything fancy or complicated, this is definitely the clicker to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I am a school librarian and I use this when teaching. You do not need to upload any software. You just plug it in and it is ready to go. It works great with my Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Works But Rattles
customer_reviews.text: The positives. 1. It worked great with my Mac - no problems. Also works with windows based of course. 2. It still works and works fine; which leads to the negative and the deduction of the star; 3) Something broke loose inside; it rattles like crazy; cannot figure out what could have possibly broken loose; but the presenter still works
customer_reviews.author: dennis doverspike

customer_reviews.title: Essential Classroom Item
customer_reviews.text: I love this clicker. I've had it for 5+ years, use it daily, and have only changed the batteries once! Great clicker, love the laser pointer, but wish it could do a little more (scroll, etc).
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. The simplicity of this unit makes it quite useful. Presenters usually find ways to always push the wrong button, but that is hard to do on this unit. My only regret is that it only seems to work with Powerpoint presentations.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Davis

customer_reviews.title: Works well to move powerpoint or prezi forward in lecture
customer_reviews.text: I use this in the lecture class I teach to move forward the Prezi. It works great for that purpose. It is easiest to use just going forward or backward: if you need to use this for a mouse function, it is not a good fit. The laser works just fine for occasional usage, but I'm not sure how well it would work if you needed to use it often and it was essential to what you were doing. Overall it worked great for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: ElizabethTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I especially like that the dongle can be safely stored inside the ...
customer_reviews.text: The first I used this product was at work, so to order it for home was a no brainer. I use this for network marketing presentations and it immediately syncs up and starts to work within a short period of inserting the Bluetooth stick to my USB drive on my Windows laptop. I especially like that the dongle can be safely stored inside the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Hoops1042

customer_reviews.title: I tried to use this with all 3 of my ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this with all 3 of my classroom computers, stand alone and laptops, but it would not work. Ordered replacement and same thing happened. I tried to troubleshoot it and all of the advice said that if it was getting power there would be a green light on the USB stick when buttons on the remote were pushed, never happened with either of the ones I ordered. I had this brand previously, but with the laser pointer, but I did not want it this time, and I did not try to order one after the second, but switched to another brand after I looked at the reviews. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Smith McCarson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I am constantly doing presentations for my job, and I love it. There are cheaper models out there, but the functionality of this one is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Karey

customer_reviews.title: Kensington presenter/pointer is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly. I simply plugged it into my Surface Pro 3 and immediately used it for my PowerPoint presentation at school. The laser pointer is strong and very visible even in well-lit rooms. The way the USB dongle stores inside the pointer assures me that I won't end up losing it or forgetting it someday. Great job to Kensington on a well built device.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: This presenter works really well with my Mac at the ...
customer_reviews.text: This presenter works really well with my Mac at the school where I teach. It works with PowerPoint and Google Drive presentations. I don't think I've tried it with Prezi yet. The only thing missing is an option I got used to on the Targus presenter for PCs: a button that puts the PowerPoint into and out of presentation mode.
customer_reviews.author: Godprayzer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Must need for presentations either at work or school. I use this while doing inservices on a daily basis while using slides. Simple, plug and play into the USB of the computer and instant connection, no need to sync. You can easily flip back and forth through your slides and emphasize points with the built in laser pointer. Factor in the affordable price, and this is a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: RONALD V DEJESUS

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WIRELESS REMOTE, POOR LASER POINTER
customer_reviews.text: The wireless control itself is awesome: it has an amazing range and allows me to roam around my classroom while still controlling my Powerpoint slides. The one weakness of this presenter is the laser: it's too weak to point to something even 15-20 feet away unless you turn off all the room lights. I recommend saving a few bucks and buying this WITHOUT the laser option--it's worthless.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Even wants other than to try it when I first received it. Waste of money zero stars.
customer_reviews.text: Put it in my computer bag to you later and when I pulled it out it didn’t work. Too late to send back haven’t used it Even wants other than to try it when I first received it. Waste of money zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Ann

customer_reviews.title: use it all the time in my classroom
customer_reviews.text: And, ..... the red laser pointer works on this model in Google slides. The red laser doesn't work on the older models in Google slide presentations.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Betlach

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed and Works Flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: I borrowed one of these from a friend, plugged it into my laptop and it worked right away. Based on that I bought one for myself and it worked the same way right out of the box. Really well thought out feature of storage for the plug in unit. Simple controls that work well each time and the black out feature is handy also. The pointer works fine and is visible in regular light situations. Really no more to say other than it works perfectly,has all the features and is well priced.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Ashby

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and super convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Easy to use and connect to numerous devices. As a teacher I use it to move around the room while controlling my smartboard and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but max range is around 50 ft
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time today and it worked great, but the advertised max range is really more like 50 ft. Also, near this range sometimes it takes 2 clicks to work, but it is still better than saying "next slide". For the price, it is a great product. Installs in seconds and works on any computer, even government computers that don't allow software installs.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

product_meta.title: Kensington Wireless Presenter with Red Laser Pointer (K33374USB)
product_meta.description: Style:Red Laser PointerProfessionals count on Kensington for control of their presentations. With a highly reliable wireless connection and intuitive controls, this remote allows you to focus on what matters most — making an effective presentation. With a 4-button layout, you can easily go forward and back on your PowerPoint or Keynote slides, while the other two buttons offer a screen blackout option and a red laser pointer. The wireless 2.4GHz receiver stores conveniently inside the remote, and since it’s uniquely paired, you don’t have to worry about device interference.
feature_bullets: Provides forward and back control of PowerPoint and keynote with no drivers needed
Plug and play simplicity requires no setup
Internal storage for wireless USB receiver so it won’t get lost

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,210 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
